evaluate_ts(events, ns=0, gamma=- 2)¶

Short function info…

Calculates the test statistic for some collection of events at a given location and for some given time profiles for signal and background. Assumes gaussian signal profile.

Parameters

  • events (ndarray) – An array of signal and background events.

  • ns (float) – A guess for the number of signal events.

  • gamma (float) – A guess for best fit spectral index of the signal.

Return type

Dict

Returns

A dictionary of the test statistic (TS) and the best fit parameters for the TS.

produce_n_trials(ntrials, test_ns=1, test_gamma=- 2, random_seed=None, flux_norm=0, gamma=- 2, sampling_width=0.017453292519943295)¶

Produces n trials and calculate a test statistic for each trial.

More function info…

Parameters

  • ntrials (int) – The number of times to repeat the trial + evaluate_ts process.

  • test_ns (float) – A guess for the number of signal events.

  • test_gamma (float) – A guess for best fit spectral index of the signal.

  • random_seed (Optional[int]) – A seed value for the numpy RNG.

  • flux_norm (float) – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma (float) – A guess for best fit spectral index of the signal.

  • sampling_width (float) – The bandwidth around the source declination to cut events.

Return type

ndarray

Returns

An array of test statistic values and their best-fit parameters for each trial.

produce_trial(reduced_sim=None, flux_norm=0, gamma=- 2, sampling_width=0.017453292519943295, random_seed=None)¶

Produces a single trial of background+signal events based on input parameters.

More function info…

Parameters

  • reduced_sim (Optional[ndarray]) – Reweighted and pruned simulated events near the source declination.

  • flux_norm (float) – A flux normaliization to adjust weights.

  • gamma (float) – A spectral index to adjust weights.

  • sampling_width (float) – The bandwidth around the source declination to cut events.

  • random_seed (Optional[int]) – A seed value for the numpy RNG.

Return type

ndarray

Returns

An array of combined signal and background events.
